_meanings:
{@--1@} Deprived of the 
original meaning or importance.

{@--4@} Made
or having become a merit or 
ornament.

{@--6@} Having a certain force or
application (as a word &c.).

(in <ab>Rhet.</ab>) the second of
the three divisions of Kāvya (poetry),
in which the charm of the  
{%suggested%} sense is not more striking than
that of the {%expressed%} one. <ls>S. D.</ls>
thus defines it:-- {#aparaM tu#} 
{#guRIBUtavyaMgyaM vAcyAdanuttame vyaMgye .#} <ls n="S. D.">265.</ls> This
division of Kāvya is further 
subdivided into 8 classes; see  
<ls>S. D. 266</ls> and <ls>K. P. 5.</ls>
